Description: Alan Turing proposed a test to assess machine intelligence.
Impact/Significance: Introduced a fundamental way to think about machine intelligence.
Birth of AI as a formal academic discipline.

Description: Frank Rosenblatt developed the first artificial neural network model.
Impact/Significance: Early work in neural networks, basis for deep learning.

Description: Gordon Moore predicted exponential growth in computing power.
Impact/Significance: Enabled the rapid growth of AI computing power.

Description: Joseph Weizenbaum developed ELIZA, an early chatbot.
UK report criticized AI progress, leading to decreased funding.
Impact/Significance: Contributed to the first AI winter.

Description: Rise of rule-based AI systems in industries.
Hinton and colleagues improved neural network training.
Impact/Significance: Major breakthrough in neural network training.

Description: IBM's Deep Blue defeated world chess champion Garry Kasparov.
Impact/Significance: First AI to defeat a world chess champion.

Description: Hinton and others reignited interest in neural networks.
Watson defeated human champions in Jeopardy!
Impact/Significance: Showcased AI's ability to understand and process natural language.

Description: Deep learning model dominated the ImageNet competition.

Impact/Significance: Led to advancements in image and video synthesis.

Description: DeepMindâ€™s AlphaGo defeated a world champion in Go.
Impact/Significance: Demonstrated AI's ability to master complex strategy games.

Description: OpenAI launched GPT-3, an advanced NLP model.
Impact/Significance: Significant improvement in text generation and understanding.

Description: OpenAI launched GPT-4, a multimodal AI model.
Impact/Significance: Further advances in reasoning and multimodal capabilities.

Description: Global governments push AI governance and regulations.
Impact/Significance: Shaping the future of AI policy and governance.
